alert.note: Alert for Hamlin (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 5:45PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast South Dakota, including the following counties, Codington and Hamlin. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain that fell in the warned area due to thunderstorms is still causing water to run over area roads and fields. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Watertown, Castlewood, Lake Norden, Bryant, Hayti, Hazel, Thomas, Goose Lake, Hamlin Education Center, Pelican Lake, Kellerton Church, Sandy Shore Rec Area, Memorial Park Camping Site, Lake Kampeska, Watertown City Park, Lake Albert, Tinkertown, Stone Bridge, Lake Poinsett and southern Lake Traverse Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
